meanings.definition: Of or relating to Gaul or France.
meanings.sent1: The Gallican culture is rich in history and tradition.
meanings.sent2: The Gallican language is spoken in certain regions of France.
meanings.sent3: The Gallican flag proudly waved in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her Gallican roots ran deep, connecting her to her ancestors.
meanings.sent5: The Gallican architecture of the building was stunningly beautiful.

meanings.definition: A supporter of the Gallican Church.
meanings.sent1: As a Gallican, he attended church services regularly.
meanings.sent2: The Gallican was devoted to his faith and community.
meanings.sent3: The Gallican joked that he had a pew reserved just for him.
meanings.sent4: She was a true Gallican, always ready to help those in need.
meanings.sent5: The Gallican's voice echoed through the church during hymns.

meanings.definition: A member of the Gallican party in France.
meanings.sent1: The Gallican was known for his strong political beliefs.
meanings.sent2: She joined the Gallican party to make a difference in her country.
meanings.sent3: The Gallican party held a festive gathering to celebrate their ideals.
meanings.sent4: He proudly wore the Gallican party pin on his lapel.
meanings.sent5: The Gallican's passion for politics was evident in every speech.
